gurmukhi: iqhUM mwq kMTn so lwey ] doaU puqR pwien lptwey ] bhur Awn sIqw pg prI ] imt geI qhIN duKn kI GrI ]829]
transliteration: Tihoon Maat Kanthan So Laae|| Dooo Poutra Paain Laptaae|| Bahur Aan Seetaa Pag Daree|| Mit Gadtaheen Doukhan Kigdaree||829||
translation: All the three mothers hugged all of them to their bosoms and Lava and Kusha came forward to touch their feet; Sita also touched their feet and it appeared that the time of suffering had ended.829lkh,

gurmukhi: bwj myD pUrn kIA j`gw ] kauslys rGubIr AB`gw ] giH spUq do pUq suhwey ] dys ibdys jIq gH Awey ]830]
transliteration: Baaj Medh Pooran Kaaa Jaggad|| Kaousales Raghoubeer Abhaggad|| Grih Sapoot Do Poot Suhaae|| Des Bides Jeet Grah Aae||830||
translation: Raghuvir Ram completed the Ashavamedha Yajna (horse-sacrifice); and in his house, his two sons seemed very impressive who had come back home after conquering many countries.830.

gurmukhi: jyiqk khy su j`g ibDwnw ] ibD pUrb kIny qy nwnw ] eyk Gwt sq kIny j`gw ] ct pt ckR ieMdR auT B`gw ]831]
transliteration: Jetik Kahe Su Jagg Bidhaanaa|| Bidh Poorab Keene Te Naanaa|| Ek Ghaat Sat Keene Jaggad|| Chat Pat Chakra Indra Outh Bhaggad||831||
translation: All the rituals of Yajna were performed according to Vedic rites, seven Yajnas were performed at one place, seeing which Indra wondered and fled away.831.

gurmukhi: rwjsuie kIny ds bwrw ] bwj myiD ie`kIs pRkwrw ] gvwlMB AjmyD Anykw ] BUp myD kr sky Anykw ]832]
transliteration: Raajsue Keene Das Baaraa|| Baaj Medh(i) Ikkees Prakaaraa|| Gadaalanbh Ajmedh Anekaa|| Bhoop Medh Kar Sake Anekaa||832||
translation: Ten Rajsu Yajnas and twenty-one kinds of Ashvamedha Yajna were performed. Go-medh, Ajmedh and Bhoop-medh several types of Yajnas were performed.832.

gurmukhi: nwgmyD Kt j`g krwey ] jaun kry jnmy jX pwey ] AaurY gnq khwN lg jwaUN ] gRMQ bFn qy hIey frwaUN ]833]
transliteration: Naagmedh Khat Jagg Karaae|| Jaoun Dare Janme Jay Paae|| Aurai Gadat Kahaan Lag Jaaoon|| Granth Badhan Te Heee Draaoon||833||
translation: Six Nagmedh Yajnas were performed which bring victory in life; to what extent I should enumerate them because there is fear of the Granth becoming voluminous.833.

gurmukhi: ds shMsR ds brK pRmwnw ] rwj krw pur AauD inDwnw ] qb lau kwl dsw nIArweI ] rGubr isir miRq fMk bjweI ]834]
transliteration: Das Sahansra Das Barakh Pramaanaa|| Raaj Karaa Pur Audh Nidhaanaa|| Tab Lau Kaal Dasaa Neearaaee|| Raghoubar Sir(i) Mrit Dank Bajaaee||834||
translation: Ram ruled in Avadphpuri for ten thousand and ten years, then according to time schedule, the death beat its drum.834.

gurmukhi: nmskwr iqh ibibiD pRkwrw ] ijn jg jIq krXo bs swrw ] sBhn sIs fMk iqh bwjw ] jIq n skw rMk Aru rwjw ]835]
transliteration: Namaskaar Tih Bibidh(i) Prakaaraa|| Jin Jag Jeet Daryo Bas Saaraa|| Sabh-han Sees Dank Tih Baajaa|| Jeet Na Sakaa Radk Ar(u) Raajaa||835||
translation: I bow before death in various ways, which has conquered the whole world and keeping it under its control. The drum of death beats on everyoneâ€™s head and no king or pauper had been able to conquer it.835.

gurmukhi: jy iqn kI srnI pry kr dY ley bcwie ] jO nhI koaU bwicAw iksn ibsn rGurwie ]836]
transliteration: Je Tin Kisarnidare Kar Dai Lae Bachaae|| Jau Nahikaoo Baachiaa|| Kisan Bisan Raghuraae||836||
translation: He, who came under its refuge, it saved him and he, who did not go under its refuge, he could not be saved whether he was Krishna or Vishnu or Ram.836.

gurmukhi: bhu ibiD kro rwj ko swjw ] dys dys ky jIqy rwjw ] swm dwm Aru dMf sBydw ] ijh ibD huqI swsnw bydw ]837]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Daro Raaj Ko Saajaa|| Des Des Ke Jeete Raajaa|| Saam Daam Ar(u) Dand Sabhedaa|| Jih Beedh Houtisaasanaa Bedaa||837||
translation: Performing his royal duties in many ways and practising Sama, Dama, Dand and Bhed and other methods of administration, Ram conquered other kings of many countries.837.

gurmukhi: brn brn ApnI kiRq lwey ] cwr cwr hI brn clwey ] CqRI krYN ib`pR kI syvw ] bYs lKY C`qRI kh dyvw ]838]
transliteration: Baran Haran Apnikrit Laae|| Chaar Chaar Hibaran Chadhaae|| Chhatridarain Bippra Kisevaa|| Bais Lakhai Chhattrikah Devaa||838||
translation: He caused every caste to do its duties and set in motion Varnashram Dharma; Kshatriyas began to serve the Brahmin and the Vaishyas considered the Kshatriyas as gods.838.

gurmukhi: sUdR sBn kI syv kmwvY ] jh koeI khY qhI vh DwvY ] jYsk huqI byd swsnw ] inksw qYs rwm kI rsnw ]839]
transliteration: Soodra Sabhan Kisev Kamaavai|| Jah Koikahai Tahivah Dhaavai|| Jaisak Houti Bed Saasanaa|| Niksaa Tais Raam Kirasnaa||839||
translation: The Shudras began to serve all and they went wherever they were sent; Ram always talked from his mouth about practicing administration according to Vedas.839.

gurmukhi: rwvxwid rx hwNk sMGwry ] BwNq BwNq syvk gx qwry ] lMkw deI tMk jnu dIno ] ieh ibD rwj jgq mY kIno ]840]
transliteration: Raavanaadh Ran Haank Sanhdare|| Bhaant Bhaant Sevak Gad Tdare|| Lankaa Daitank Jan(u) Deeno|| Eh Bidh Raaj Jagad Mai Keeno||840||
translation: Ram ruled by killing the tyrants like Ravana, by emancipating different devotees and attendants (ganas) and by collecting the taxes of Lanka.840.
